intro: Fimbristylis hirtella, commonly known as hairy threadgrass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, perennial herb that typically grows in wet or seasonally wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it its common name. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of tiny, spike-like flowers. Fimbristylis hirtella is often found in tropical and subtropical regions and plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils.
